intro: Diplocos, commonly known as the double-seed plant, is a unique species characterized by its distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to certain regions of Africa. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that contain two seeds each, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a smooth, waxy surface. Diplocos is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to harsh climatic conditions.
